file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 30-11-05-05 - WING ANTI-ICING LEAK THERMOSTAT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WING ANTI-ICING LEAK THERMOSTAT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do an operational check of the wing leak thermostats. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY WING LEAK THERMOSTAT - OPERA- ALL 30-11-05-700-801-A ♦ TIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 30-11-05 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-11-05-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WING LEAK THERMOSTAT - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) The leak thermostat is installed near the wing anti-icing valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE CMC DOWNLOADING WITH THE PERSONAL COM- AMM TASK 45-45-00-970-802-A/200 PUTER S.B.145-45-0001 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191EL Left side of the wing-to-fuselage fairing 191 191FR Right side of the wing-to-fuselage fairing 223 223LZ Cockpit, LH side - Maintenance Panel D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Heat Gun To apply hot air available Commercially Digital Thermometer - range up to To measure the temperature available 93.3ÃÂ°C (200ÃÂ°F) E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 A - Does the task Cockpit 1 B - Helps technician A Near the wing EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 30-11-05 Page 2 of 5 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Remove the access panels that follow (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100), as applicable. – 191EL (leak thermostat of the LH half wing). – 191FR (leak thermostat of the RH half wing). (3) Open maintenance panel door 223LZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) to get access to: – (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) The CMC RESET/INHIBIT switch. – (POST-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) The CMC RESET/ENABLE switch. (4) Make sure that these switches, on the Maintenance panel, are at the middle position: – (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) CMC RESET/INHIBIT switch. – (POST-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) CMC RESET/ENABLE switch. J. Operational Check of the Wing Leak Thermostat (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A WARNING: BECAUSE OF THE HIGH TEMPERATURES, BE CAREFUL NOT TO BURN YOURSELF WHEN YOU HEAT THE LEAK THERMOSTAT. (1) Do the check as follows: (a) (POST-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) Turn the CMC RESET/ENABLE switch, on the Maintenance panel, to the ENABLE position. (b) Slowly and continuously increase the temperature of the leak thermostat on the LH and RH half wing with a heat gun until it is higher than 93.3 ÃÂ°C (200 ÃÂ°F). NOTE: The leak thermostat temperature cannot be higher than 250 ÃÂ°C (482 ÃÂ°F). (c) Do a CMC downloading ( AMM TASK 45-45-00-970-802-A/200) and make sure that these messages come into view: Result: 1 WING 1 A/ICE LEAK and WING 2 A/ICE LEAK. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) (POST-MOD. S.B.145-45-0001) Turn the CMC RESET/ENABLE switch, on the Maintenance panel, to the middle position. (2) De-energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Install the access panels that follow (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100), as applicable: – 191EL (leak thermostat of the LH half wing). – 191FR (leak thermostat of the RH half wing). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 30-11-05 Page 3 of 5 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Close maintenance panel door 223LZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 30-11-05 Page 4 of 5 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
